subject: Law
title: Juvenile Justice
description: Learn Juvenile Justice in one minute.

hook.text: A 14-year-old was sentenced to life without parole. The Supreme Court eventually said that's unconstitutional.

buildup.text: The juvenile justice system was created on the idea that children are differentâ€”more capable of rehabilitation.

discovery.text: Miller v. Alabama (2012) banned mandatory life without parole for juveniles, requiring individual consideration.

twist.text: Despite the ruling, thousands of juveniles remain in adult prisons across the country.

climax.text: Brain science now confirms what the Court recognized: adolescent brains aren't fully developed until the mid-20s.

punchline.text: Children who commit crimes are still children. The law is catching up.

quiz.question: What did Miller v. Alabama rule about juvenile sentencing?
options: All juveniles must be tried as adults
Mandatory life without parole for juveniles is unconstitutional
